pullRequest.body:
Prompted by [this Zulip message](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/116290-rss/topic/Recent.20Commits.20to.20mathlib4.3Amaster/near/430753770), I unified all the uses that I could find of "list all files in some dir and create an 'import file' for them".

In the process, I added a slight flexibility to the `mk_all` script: if you pass it a space-separated list of target dirs, it will produce 'import files' for each dir in the list.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: With this PR, the `mk_all` script becomes part of CI: should it be `actionLinted`?  If so, is it enough to simply move the script to `.github/workflows`?
I do wonder about the duplication in mathlib's CI - did you really have to write the same thing *four times*? But this is beyond this PR...

Thanks for so quickly addressing my comments. I think this is worth trying out; see [my comment above](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11849#pullrequestreview-2074603523) for details.
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9218346948/job/25361730857)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9218346948/job/25361730644)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9218346948/job/25361730792)

I think this is a good change and a clear step forward. Thank you for refactoring mathlib's CI!

Re-writing the `mk_all` script in Lean is another step forward, but I don't see a reason to block this step on that. I have only minor comments - with these addressed (most by simply merging master), I'll approve.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

I think this is a good change and a clear step forward. Thank you for refactoring mathlib's CI!

Re-writing the `mk_all` script in Lean is another step forward, but I don't see a reason to block this step on that. I have only minor comments - with these addressed (most by simply merging master), I'll approve.

Michael, as usual, thank you so much for your comments!

I have accepted them all and merged master: the PR is much cleaner now!

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Is this really necessary?
Not sure: I'll test once I am at a computer.
A few weeks later... you were right, it was not needed and I removed it!
I don't know enough bash to review this, but would approve the CI changes.

If it helps, `-n` checks whether the variable is assigned and non empty. `$*` means "all arguments passed to the function".

Basically, either the user passes some arguments and the script uses those, or, we use the default set of arguments.

I've looked at this enough to convince myself this should do what it says.

I do think bash scripts are not nice to maintain long-term --- but since #11874 is rewriting this in Lean, I am not worried about that. Short-term, this seems fine and like a clear step forward.

Thinking about this again, I don't see the use case for passing arguments to this script. Unless there's a strong reason for it that I haven't thought about, I'd revert that part. The main selling point of this script is that it's simple and fast, IMO.
The reason I added that option is for downstream projects that can target whichever folder they want.  This was before the lean script, though.

How about one of these?
```suggestion
      - name: update import-only files {Mathlib Mathlib/Tactic Counterexamples Archive}.lean
 ```
```suggestion
      - name: update lists of files in {Mathlib Mathlib/Tactic Counterexamples Archive}.lean
I went for the first option: `update import-only files`

Let's revert this stray change (and simply land the rewrite of the hashCommandLinter instead). Morally, I'd like to suggest re-instating this line - as github won't let me, here's just the line for you to copy if you like.
```
         chmod u+x scripts/lint_hash_commands.sh
Re-instated!
As above, I suggest tweaking this description.
These files are meant to be changed once and repeated with a script: I updated the "master" one (`build.yml.in`), the rest is done by `./.github/workflows/mk_build_yml.sh`.
Also, please revert this change.
Same here.
And here.
As above.
As above.
If you rebase this PR/merge master, this change will go away :-)
As above.
These will also go away when rebasing/merging master.

I personally would start with a one-sentence description, something like: "create or update a file with all imports in a given directory" or list of directories. (Or shamelessly copying from #11874, something like "Generate a file importing all the files of a Lean folder. By default, it generates the files for the libraries `Mathlib`, `Mathlib/Tactic`, `Archive` and `Counterexamples`.")
I went for the second option, thanks!

```suggestion
##  updates `Mathlib.lean`, `Mathlib/Tactic.lean`, `Counterexamples.lean` and `Archive.lean`
Done
"Advanced use" maybe?
Changed to `Advanced`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: update mk_all script and use it in CI

nodes.body: With this PR, the `mk_all` script becomes part of CI: should it be `actionLinted`?  If so, is it enough to simply move the script to `.github/workflows`?

I think this is a good change and a clear step forward. Thank you for refactoring mathlib's CI!

Re-writing the `mk_all` script in Lean is another step forward, but I don't see a reason to block this step on that. I have only minor comments - with these addressed (most by simply merging master), I'll approve.
I do wonder about the duplication in mathlib's CI - did you really have to write the same thing *four times*? But this is beyond this PR...

source.title: Update lakefile with scripts for import generation
